name: N-(9-fluorenylmethoxycarbonyloxy)succinimide
Reason: 9-Fluorenylmethoxycarbonyloxy group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The fluorenyl group itself contributes to the melting point due to its high molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +30°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The carbonyl group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, estimated at around +40°C. The succinimide group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of these functional groups raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight, van der Waals interactions, and hydrogen bonding.
